item.title: Fouad add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "When a thing has been said and said well, have no scruple. Take it and copy it." -- Anatole France

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Rabindranath Tagore
item.description: "Whatever we understand and enjoy in human products instantly becomes ours, wherever they might have their origin... Let me feel with unalloyed gladness that all the great glories of man are mine. " -- Rabindranath Tagore

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Gautama Buddha
item.description: "Three things can not hide for long: the Moon, the Sun and the Truth." -- Gautama Buddha

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Jiddu Krishnamurti
item.description: "When you call yourself an Indian or a Muslim or a Christian or a European, or anything else, you are being violent. Do you see why it is violent? Because you are separating yourself from the rest of mankind. When you separate yourself by belief, by nationality, by tradition, it breeds violence. So a man who is seeking to understand violence does not belong to any country, to any religion, to any political party or partial system; he is concerned with the total understanding of mankind." -- Jiddu Krishnamurti

item.title: Fouad add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars." -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The most perfidious way of harming a cause consists of defending it deliberately with faulty arguments." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Abraham Joshua Heschel
item.description: "When I was young, I used to admire intelligent people; as I grow older, I admire kind people." -- Abraham Joshua Heschel

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "God depends on us. It is through us that God is achieved." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Be faithful to that which exists within yourself." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Bobby Knight
item.description: "Most people have the will to win, few have the will to prepare to win." -- Bobby Knight

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "A person with ubuntu is open and available to others, affirming of others, does not feel threatened that others are able and good, for he or she has a proper self-assurance that comes from knowing that he or she belongs in a greater whole and is diminished when others are humiliated or diminished, when others are tortured or oppressed." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Fouad add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Life is a long lesson in humility." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Johann wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "knowing is not enough,we must apply willing is not enough,we must do.." -- Johann wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Blinding ignorance does mislead us. O! Wretched mortals, open your eyes!" -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The noblest pleasure is the joy of understanding." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Malcolm S. Forbes
item.description: "The purpose of education is to replace an empty mind with an open one." -- Malcolm S. Forbes

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing." -- Socrates

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Abu Bakr
item.description: "Knowledge is the life of the mind." -- Abu Bakr

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Mother Teresa of Calcutta
item.description: "It is a kingly act to assist the fallen." -- Mother Teresa of Calcutta

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "When you have come to the edge of all the light you have And step into the darkness of the unknown Believe that one of the two will happen to you Either you'll find something solid to stand on Or you'll be taught how to fly!" -- Richard Bach

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Martin Luther King, Jr
item.description: "Every man must decide whether he will walk in the light of creative altruism or in the darkness of destructive selfishness." -- Martin Luther King, Jr

item.title: Fouad add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The supreme reality of our time is the vulnerability of our planet. " -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Fouad add a quote by Stephen Covey
item.description: "There are three constants in life... Change, Choice and Principles." -- Stephen Covey

item.title: Fouad add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "We are not like that. We know that no one ever seizes power with the intention of relinquishing it. Power is not a means, it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship. The object of persecution is persecution. The object of terrorism is terrorism. The object of oppression is oppression. The object of torture is torture. The object of murder is murder. The object of power is power. Now do you begin to understand me?" -- George Orwell
